unnormalised: IIT Bombay announced the 2nd cutoff list for its M.Tech programs on 25/06/2024. The initial list, released on 10/06, saw a large number of students accepting seats. However, several spots remained vacant, particularly in the AI and Data Science departments. The closing rank for Computer Science in the 1st list was 500, while the Electrical Engineering cutoff stood at 800. This 2nd list aims to fill the remaining ~20% seats.
normalised: I-I-T Bombay announced the second cutoff list for its M-Tech programs on twenty fifth june two thousand and twenty four. The initial list, released on tenth june, saw a large number of students accepting seats. However, several spots remained vacant, particularly in the A-I and Data Science departments. The closing rank for Computer Science in the first list was five hundred, while the Electrical Engineering cutoff stood at eight hundred. This second list aims to fill the remaining approximately twenty percent seats.

unnormalised: According to Dr. Rajesh Kumar, Dean of Academic Affairs, “This year, we've seen a slight increase in applications compared to last year. The competition is definitely fierce, especially for courses like CSE and ECE. The cutoff marks are expected to remain high.” The next round of admissions is scheduled for 10/07/24. Students are advised to check the official website for the updated list and further instructions.
normalised: According to Doctor Rajesh Kumar, Dean of Academic Affairs, “This year, we've seen a slight increase in applications compared to last year. The competition is definitely fierce, especially for courses like C-S-E and E-C-E. The cutoff marks are expected to remain high.” The next round of admissions is scheduled for tenth july two thousand and twenty four. Students are advised to check the official website for the updated list and further instructions.

unnormalised: Sources suggest that the number of international applicants from countries like Nepal and Bangladesh have also increased by almost 15% this year. While a general category student needed a GATE score of 750+, OBC candidates could get in with scores around 680 in the first round. Details of the cutoff scores, category-wise, are available on iitb.ac.in.
normalised: Sources suggest that the number of international applicants from countries like Nepal and Bangladesh have also increased by almost fifteen percent this year. While a general category student needed a G-A-T-E score of seven hundred and fifty plus, O-B-C candidates could get in with scores around six hundred and eighty in the first round. Details of the cutoff scores, category-wise, are available on i-i-t-b dot a-c dot i-n.
